result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $2730.00 entered as ordered by the court on 12/09/2016  to pay $25.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 03/02/2026. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
(and) Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.  Signed, scanned and forwarded to CH104 for processing.  sdg
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs signed.  Filed by Michael Plaisted  $2730.00

Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT(S) 1 AND 2:

On Motion of the State,  Court ordered Count(s) 1 and 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 3:

On Motion of the State,  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to count 3.

Court sentenced defendant to serve THIRTY-THREE (33) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for THIRTY-THREE (33) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02-07-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Filed, Justice Point Discharge Summary

Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNTS 1-3:  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered case transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for review hearing.  Court ordered the defendant to possess no firearms.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties advised the Court that this matter will be part of the Veteran's Treatment Initiative.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM036787  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/06/2015
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPORS OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 24.

Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State objects as to a bail reduction.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered no contact with Holly J.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 will not be in session on August 6, 2015 in the pm.  Case rescheduled to August 6, 2015 at 8:30 am for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Clerk notified Deputy Cleveland to have defendant produced in the am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains the same.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted as a friend of the Court,  in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case is being heard for branch 24. 
  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints  Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant.  Attorney  Michael Plaisted  accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the conclusion of the case or a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Holly J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Harold Anthony Hoppenrath in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.    Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  

DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am. in Branch 47 for Branch 24.
